properties.name: Arizmendi
properties.description: Posted by Dennis3265 lakeshore ave. oakland 94610A co-op bakery. Really great. 1/2 baked pizza\'s to go are great for dinner. Lots of sweet or savory breakfast baked goods on the weekend!

properties.name: Bakesale Betty
properties.description: Posted by Dennis5098 Telegraph Ave, Oakland, CAThe wacky aussie-chick with the blue hair, the amazing bakery talent, and a wonderful urge to feed you fantastic baked goods is, of course, Bakesale Betty. Everything in there is fantastic, period. My favorite baked treats? Probably the scones. They are, hands down, the best scones I have ever had. There is something else you should know about. They also make sandwiches around lunch time. Note: they DO sell out of the sandwiches. No matter how many they make, they sell out. And I\'m going to admit something right here on the internets in front of Google and everyone: I have ordered her fried chicken sandwich three times, and all three times it has been SO good that it has brought a tear to my eye. If you think I\'m exaggerating, show up on time and order one for yourself! Hot fried chicken on a fresh warm roll, topped with spicy coleslaw, it\'s just the best.

properties.name: Ben & Nick's Bar & Grill
properties.description: Posted by Dennis5612 College, Ave, Oakland, CAA pub with lots of beers and food. The Nicken Supreme is a great chicken pesto sandwich. Their turkey burgers are also great. Good with fries or salad, and--of course--a beer.

properties.name: Berkeley Thai House
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2511 Channing Way, Berkeley, CAWe\'ve always seen it more of a dinner-style Thai place than a straight up Thai lunch location. Fancier than our usual Thai fixes. I haven\'t had them in a while, but their stuffed wings have always rocked.

properties.name: Burrito Shop
properties.description: Posted by Dennis 3256 Lakeshore Ave, Oakland, CAI\'m going to get hell from Joe for including a burrito shop with burrito in the name which doesn\'t serve good traditional burritos, but here goes. The two things Amber and I really like here are the grilled chicken burrito (have them add BBQ sauce), and the thai chicken burrito. Yes, the latter is probably better categorized as a wrap, but it\'s really good. It\'s sweet and it\'s spicy, it\'s got grilled chicken and cabbage, and it\'s good.

properties.name: Cafe Durant
properties.description: Posted by Dennis 2517 Durant Ave, Berkeley, CASunny upstairs breakfast patio. The crepes are good, and the chiliquiles are fantastic! Fresh OJ! Bring your sunglasses and it\'s a great hangover recovery center.

properties.name: Cafe Intermezzo
properties.description: Posted by Dennis 2442 Telegraph Ave, Berkeley, CATHE salad mecca. There is no place else like this in the world. (I haven\'t been everywhere else in the world, but I\'m fairly certain I can say this.) The Vegi-Delight w/ poppy seed dressing is an amazing salad which will blow your mind. It\'s enough for two... trust me! Their lemonade is good too, and you get free refills.

properties.name: Chao Thai
properties.description: Posted by Dennis482 Lake Park Ave, Oakland, CASet back from the street. We like the spicy eggplant house special, but with chicken. We also like their steamed veggies w/ peanut sauce, the red curry beef stew, and you must try their garlic rice!

properties.name: Coach Sushi
properties.description: Posted by Dennis532 Grand Ave, Oakland, CAJoe\'s new favorite sushi spot. He\'s already such a regular that Coach brings out Joe\'s signed wooden masu sake cup as soon as Joe sits down. The place has a warm and friendly "mom & pop" feel to it.

properties.name: Colonial Donuts
properties.description: Posted by Dennis3318 Lakeshore Ave., Oakland, CA 94610-2306aka: "CoDo." A Lakeshore Ave treasure. 24 hour donuts! Get fresh ones off the rack if you want one that\'s still hot. Sometimes you can also watch a game or two of chess in progress while you eat your donut.

properties.name: Crepevine
properties.description: Posted by Dennis5600 College Avenue Oakland CaBig salad and crepe combo plates. My favorite is the Tuscan--it\'s a pesto chicken crepe.

properties.name: Gelataria Naia
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2106 Shattuck Ave Berkeley CaJust elbow your way to the front of the overwhelmed masses and get a taste of something yummy! It\'s a little pricey for a cup of gelato, but when you find a good flavor combination, it\'s worth it! Menu changes frequently. Once, I mixed a bitter dark chocolate and their grapefruit gelatos together. Bitter and sweet got married that night, and had a dessert baby that was out of this world.

properties.name: Genova Delicatessen & Ravioli Factory
properties.description: Posted by Dennis5095 Telegraph Ave # A, Oakland, CAAt Telegraph Ave and 51st, in a little plaza of shops. Don\'t arrive during the lunch rush if you\'re starving, there WILL be a line. But the wait is worth it! Some of my East Coast friends say it\'s the only decent sandwich in the East Bay! Check the board for the sandwich specials, they\'re really good.

properties.name: George & Walt's
properties.description: Posted by Dennis5445 College Ave, Oakland, CAA bar. Last time I was there, they were still making whiskey sours from scratch! That\'s a treat! It\'s hard to find a bar that makes a good whiskey sour. Amber and I like them made w/ Jack Daniel\'s.

properties.name: Great Wall
properties.description: Posted by Dennis6247 College Ave, Oakland, CAAll vegi chinese restaurant. Our favorites are tan-tan noodle, eggplant w/ spicy garlic sauce, and steamed rice. (I like to mix all three together.) Fast, cheap, and delicious!

properties.name: Hong Kong East Ocean Seafood
properties.description: Posted by Dennis3199 Powell St, Emeryville, CASunday morning/afternoon dim sum extravaganza. Amazing food, spectacular bay view. Our favorites: stuffed mushroom & eggplant, spicy noodle special, shiu mai, stuffed crab claw special, deep fried meat buns, steamed pork buns, jasmine tea, and deep fried custard balls for dessert.

properties.name: Jade Villa
properties.description: Posted by Dennis800 Broadway, Oakland, CAA great dim sum place. Wide tea selection, pretty affordable, and they have a to-go counter!

properties.name: Kingpin Donuts
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2521 Durant Ave, Berkeley, CAI\'m a sucker for a chocolate old-fashioned donut, what more can I say?

properties.name: Kirala
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2100 Ward St, Berkeley, CAA fancy sushi place. Expensive, but really good. We only think it\'s worth the price (and the wait) if you\'re gonna sit at the bar. Chat up the chef, buy him a beer, and find out what\'s especially good that night!

properties.name: Kwik Way
properties.description: Posted by Dennis500 Lake Park Ave, Oakland, CATwo words... corn dogs.

properties.name: La Mediterranee
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2936 College Ave, Berkeley, CAWelcome to La Med. Our favorite thing to do is get the mediterranean Mezze dinner for two, you\'ll get to try everything. It\'s a wide selection of little plates topped with all sorts of mediterranean treats to stuff into your pita bread. The spiced coffee is great for dessert.

properties.name: Lanesplitter Pizza & Pub
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2033 San Pablo Avenue, Berkeley, CA 94702Our wildly adorable friend Alice used to work at this location often. She\'s going back to school, but I think you can still catch her behind the bar from time to time. This place is owned by friends of ours, often displays art by folks we know (including me at one point), and almost always has people I know hanging out there. So yeah, I like it. Their two locations proudly dispense their beer at "pub" temperatures. As a former bartender, let me assure you that once you\'ve developed a taste for beer at the right temperature, you\'ll be dissapointed to realize that most places serve their beer too cold.

properties.name: Lanesplitter Pizza & Pub, Temescal
properties.description: Posted by Dennis4799 Telegraph Ave, Oakland, CAThis is the alternate location of the San Pablo Ave pub of the same name. As I noted on the entry for the Berkeley location, their two pubs proudly dispense their beer at "pub" temperatures. As a former bartender, let me assure you that once you\'ve developed a taste for beer at the right temperature, you\'ll be dissapointed to realize that most places serve their beer too cold.

properties.name: Little Shin Shin
properties.description: Posted by Dennis4258 Piedmont Ave, Oakland, CAGreat chinese food. Among other things, we like the... I forget what it\'s called... tofu noodles w/ soy beans? It\'s under "house specials." I like all their combinations of green or long beans with the various sauces. Great pot stickers too.

properties.name: Long Life Veggie House
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2129 University Ave, Berkeley, California, United States, North AmericaVeggi-everything. I like string beans w/ spicy garlic sauce. Actually... anything w/ the spicy garlic sauce! Like, vegi-beef w/ broccoli, or green beans, or asparagus. VERY filling!

properties.name: Lucky House
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2140 University Ave, Berkeley, CAGreat Lao/Thai food!

properties.name: Lynn & Lu's
properties.description: Posted by Dennis3353 Grand Ave, Oakland, CAGood breakfast spot with a patio garden upstairs in the back.

properties.name: Mijori
properties.description: Posted by Dennis3260 Grand Ave, Oakland, CAGood deals on great sushi. We used to live right up the hill from Mijori, and we\'d walk there all the time.

properties.name: New Gold Medal: formerly Sun Hong Kong
properties.description: Posted by Dennis381 8th Street, Oakland, CAThis place used to be called Sun Hong Kong. There must have been a change of ownership, but the menu and the quality haven\'t changed. Which is good, because I\'ve been ordering the same thing since the early 90\'s, and I don\'t want it to change! OPEN LATE! Until 3am, or something crazy like that. Go there, and get the "BBQ pork wonton noodle soup with chinese broccoli." (We affectionately call this "Soup Hong Kong.") It doesn\'t normally come with the broccoli, but they can add it if you ask. Don\'t freak out at the way the street smells, or the weird things hanging in the window, or the scary person with the cleaver by the door, or the weird fish in the tanks in the back of the restaurant. Trust the smiling faces of the people eating, and try the soup!!! The soup is particularly good if you\'re felling run-down, tired, or sick, but you\'re hungry! Warning, the wontons have shrimp in them. (Jeff, man, I\'m sorry. I forgot you were allergic!)

properties.name: Pho AnhDao
properties.description: Posted by Dennis280 East 18th St, Oakland, CAAmber and I love this place. We pretty much stick with the Tai (rare eye of round steak beef noodle soup) or the Pho Ga (chicken noodle soup). Both are great, affordable, filling, and available in three sizes. The regular is enough for Amber, the large is enough for me. I can\'t imagine eating an extra large bowl. Their spring roll appetizers are also really good.

properties.name: Picante
properties.description: Posted by Dennis1328 6th St, Berkeley, CAA little pricey for mexican food, but the sopa azteca is a fantastic bowl of spicy chicken tortilla soup, and the tostadas on corn tortillas are really great. (Especially with manchamanteles, which is a red chicken mole, or their chili verde.) An extra side of handmade corn tortillas is often unavoidable. So are their agua frescas.

properties.name: Plearn
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2050 University Ave, Berkeley, CAA classic lunch menu which we used to ravage weekly when I worked up the hill.

properties.name: Racha Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Dennis 2516 Telegraph Ave, Berkeley, CACheap pad-thai, which kept me fed through college. It\'s next to Berkeley Hat Company, which is also fun.

properties.name: Raleigh's
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2438 Telegraph Ave, Berkeley, CAThree things I especially like here: blue cheese burgers, beer battered onion rings, and their beer garden! (Sorry Susan, I know you were bummed that they built it when you lived over it and your living room overlooked the garden, and sometimes it was loud on Friday nights. But I\'ve since spent a lot of time back there, and think it\'s a great place to hang out.)

properties.name: Rolling Dunes
properties.description: Posted by Dennis3331 Lakeshore Ave, Oakland, CAAmber likes the crepes, I like to have breakfast for dinner.

properties.name: Saigon Express
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2045 Shattuck Ave, Berkeley, CATheir soup bowls, "pho," are amazing. The rest of the menu is ok, but for me, it\'s all about their pho. Rare sliced beef pho is the best, chicken noodle is also great, so is the vegi pho (which is better when you order it with beef broth). The plum sauce comes in a squeeze bottle! (So does the Sri Racha spicy sauce.) Awesome!!

properties.name: Smokehouse
properties.description: Posted by Dennis3115 Telegraph Ave, Oakland, CAA great dive-y burger joint. We like the chili-cheese fries, especially as a late night snack! Open late!

properties.name: Spettro
properties.description: Posted by Dennis3355 Lakeshore Ave, Oakland, CAA fun, bustling restaurant. Especially fun the week of Halloween! California/Italian/New Orleans cuisine. Menu changes often. The house wine in carafes is cheap and decent. Great salads (like the Booberry!) and pasta dishes.

properties.name: Steve's Korean BBQ
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2521 Durant Ave, Berkeley, CAAnother place which helped to make sure I didn\'t starve while in school. I love the big plate of BBQ chicken over rice. Sometimes I\'d get it mixed with veggies, but sometimes I would just want the chicken piled on the rice, and that\'s it. I love their hot sauce.

properties.name: Ta-Ke Sushi
properties.description: Posted by Dennis357 Grand Ave, Oakland, CAAlong the side of Lake Merrit. Take a walk down to see the ducks before dinner! This is where we bought sushi trays for our wedding. Decent prices for really great sushi. I like the "whe-do-bop": a bowl of steamed rice, topped with lettuce and lots of sashimi and a side of spicy-smokey sauce. Amber likes their bento boxes. Everything is good though.

properties.name: Taqueria Sinaloa
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2138 International Blvd, Oakland, CADisclaimer: I hate to say this, but just want to be clear. Taqueria Sinaloa is not in a good neighborhood. I think it\'s plenty safe as a lunch stop, but I don\'t recommend it in the evening or night.Review: This place elevates the concept of a Taco Truck to a heavenly art form. It\'s in Seth\'s fire district, and sometimes the firefighters stop by for tacos, so we took that as a pretty good recommendation because those guys know how to eat.Oh man! Yum!The carnitas tacos are fantastic. Amber said the taco al pastor was great too. My second helping was a taco with tripitas and salt. (No salsa or anything.) Crispy and flavorful, wrapped in a handmade corn tortilla, what\'s not to like?The corner parcel includes the actual Sinaloa restaurant. They have two trucks they run out in the surrounding lot: one for meat, and one for seafood. So if you want a shrimp tostada, head to the white truck in back. For your standard meat cravings, step up to the big orange truck in front!Gracias amigo!

properties.name: Thai Delight
properties.description: Posted by Dennis1700 Shattuck Ave, Berkeley, CAMy friends tell me there is more to the menu than the Lunch Combo "C," but I haven\'t found any reason to look further than this fantastic satay, salad, and green curry chicken combo plate.

properties.name: Top Dog
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2534 Durant Ave, Berkeley, CAI like the Calabrese, butterflied, with mustards and saurkraut. Or a Bockwurst with mustard and relish. Or even both. YUM!!!

properties.name: Top Dog, Oakland
properties.description: Posted by Dennis5100 Broadway, Oakland, CAI like the Calabrese, butterflied, with mustard and saurkraut. Or a Bockwurst with mustard and relish. Or both. YUM!!! This Top Dog is in the foyer of the Longs Drugs (formerly Payless) in the big shopping center on the corner of Broadway and 51st/Pleasant Valley Road (51st becomes PVR at Broadway).

properties.name: Townhouse Bar & Grill
properties.description: Posted by Dennis5862 Doyle Street, Emeryville, CAA very nice restaurant with a classy bar. Look up and check out their gorgeous walnut-shell blasted ceiling. They make a big salad with chicken and apples and pecans which is fantastic!

properties.name: Yogurt Park
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2433 Durant Ave, Berkeley, CAWho doesn\'t like frozen yogurt (fro-yo, frogurt, whatever YOU call it) on a nice day/evening when you\'re wandering around Berkeley?

properties.name: Yokohamma Station
properties.description: Posted by Dennis2521 Durant Ave, Berkeley, CASet in the food court. A really sweet woman runs the place. She says "thank you!" a lot. The food is a GREAT deal! We always get "sauteed vegetables w/ tofu". It\'s cheap, it\'s healthy, it\'s garlicy! One of our favorite stops, for there or to go. Sometimes my brain won\'t let me escape the food court without a chocolate old-fashioned from Kingpin Donuts next door.

properties.name: Zachary's Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Dennis1853 Solano Ave, Berkeley, CATheir thin crust slices are great if you want to just walk in off the street. But Zachary\'s is all about their stuffed pizzas: the spinach and mushroom, the chicken, the mediteranean, or the pepperoni... they\'re all real belly-busters! Great for parties. Two locations, this one, and another near the Rockridge Bart stop.

properties.name: Zachary's Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Dennis5801 College Ave, Oakland, CATheir thin crust slices are great if you want to just walk in off the street. But Zachary\'s is all about their stuffed pizzas: the spinach and mushroom, the chicken, the mediteranean, or the pepperoni... they\'re all real belly-busters! Great for parties. Two locations, this one, and another over on Solano Ave in Berkeley.
